author: Georgia Wells
title: Snap Makes Gains in Bid to Vie With Big Rivals; Shares Rocket - WSJ
text:
Snap Inc.’s stock surged more than 25% after the company reignited revenue and user growth for the first time as a publicly traded firm, a promising sign that may reflect progress in persuading advertisers its Snapchat app is a viable alternative to Facebook and Google.
The social-media company said Tuesday it doubled its loss in the fourth quarter, but sales rose 72% to $285.7 million from a year earlier, besting Wall Street’s revenue forecast and reviving growth after three consecutive quarters of a slowdown. The loss,...
